synthesis_method: The electrolyte synthesis process involved mixing lithium sulfide, 5-sulfide 2, silicon sulfide, and lithium chloride in specified proportions, ball milling the mixture for 40 hours in a zirconia pot under argon, transferring the resulting ion conductive material powder into a carbon-coated quartz tube, vacuum-sealing, heating in a furnace to 550°C for 8 hours, and cooling to room temperature to yield a sulfide solid electrolyte material with a composition of 0.11(LiCl)·(Li3.4Si0.4P0.6S4).
